list-members.name: List PushPress members
list-members.prompt: Using the PushPress TypeScript SDK (`@pushpress/pushpress`), write a script in solution.ts that lists members (customers) from the PushPress API. Install all dependencies first with npm. The PUSHPRESS_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use process.env.PUSHPRESS_API_KEY for authentication. Do not run the script.
list-members.description: PushPress TypeScript SDK — API references for members, checkins, webhooks, and classes

assertions.command: npx -p typescript tsc --noEmit --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --module commonjs --target es2020 solution.ts
assertions.name: typecheck

assertions.command: output=$(npx tsx solution.ts 2>&1) && echo "$output" | head -20 | grep -qi 'member\|customer\|name\|email'
assertions.name: runs-successfully

get-checkins.name: Get PushPress checkins
get-checkins.prompt: Using the PushPress TypeScript SDK (`@pushpress/pushpress`), write a script in solution.ts that retrieves recent checkins from the PushPress API. Install all dependencies first with npm. The PUSHPRESS_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use process.env.PUSHPRESS_API_KEY for authentication. Do not run the script.

assertions.command: npx -p typescript tsc --noEmit --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --module commonjs --target es2020 solution.ts
assertions.name: typecheck

assertions.command: output=$(npx tsx solution.ts 2>&1) && echo "$output" | head -20 | grep -qi 'checkin\|check'
assertions.name: runs-successfully

create-webhook.name: Create PushPress webhook
create-webhook.prompt: Using the PushPress TypeScript SDK (`@pushpress/pushpress`), write a script in solution.ts that registers a webhook to listen for events. Install all dependencies first with npm. The PUSHPRESS_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use process.env.PUSHPRESS_API_KEY for authentication. Do not run the script.

assertions.command: npx -p typescript tsc --noEmit --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --module commonjs --target es2020 solution.ts
assertions.name: typecheck

assertions.command: output=$(npx tsx solution.ts 2>&1) && echo "$output" | head -20 | grep -qi 'webhook\|event\|created'
assertions.name: runs-successfully

list-classes.name: List PushPress classes
list-classes.prompt: Using the PushPress TypeScript SDK (`@pushpress/pushpress`), write a script in solution.ts that lists available classes or scheduled sessions. Install all dependencies first with npm. The PUSHPRESS_API_KEY environment variable is already set — use process.env.PUSHPRESS_API_KEY for authentication. Do not run the script.

assertions.command: npx -p typescript tsc --noEmit --esModuleInterop --moduleResolution node --module commonjs --target es2020 solution.ts
assertions.name: typecheck

assertions.command: output=$(npx tsx solution.ts 2>&1) && echo "$output" | head -20 | grep -qi 'class\|schedule\|session'
assertions.name: runs-successfully
